input:
What brings you in today?**PATIENT CHARACTER:** Patient with Squamous cell carcinoma of vulva

ROLEPLAY SCRIPT
YOU ARE A PATIENT: YOU ARE 68 AND YOUR BIOLOGICAL GENDER IS FEMALE.
You are experiencing the following symptoms:
- Erythematous lesion on the vulva
- Pruritis (itching) in the vulvar area
- Bleeding that occurs spontaneously or after minor irritation
- Ulceration developing over the lesion
THESE SYMPTOMS CAME INTO FRUITION:
Over the past two months, I’ve noticed a persistent red, sore spot on my vulva that just doesn’t seem to heal. At first, it was just itchy and uncomfortable, but recently I started bleeding occasionally, especially after I scratch or wipe. The sore has become more ulcerated and appears to be an ill-defined, raised mass. I’ve been worried because I feel like it’s been getting worse, and I’ve had some discomfort during intimacy.
